summary: hajj is the largest annual recurring religious mass gathering in the world occurring in mecca, Saudi Arabia. more than 25 million people from at least 180 countries participate simultaneously in this MG. such a MG can raise the risks of public health issues such as respiratory infections, meningococcal outbreaks, and foodborne diseases. a total of 3200 people from the two provinces of fars and Kohgiluyeh va Buyer Ahmad, southern Iran, participated in the 2009 Hajj. the duration of the Hajj is 1 week but MG lasts for about 30 days. nasopharyngeal and pharyngeal swabs are reportedly more suitable for respiratory virus isolation. the dacron swabs on a flexible plastic shaft were collected in viral transport medium (VTM) and stored at 4°C before being quickly transported to the Professor Alborzi Clinical Microbiology Research Center at Namazi Hospital, Shiraz. the amplification process was performed using TaqMan 1Step RTPCR Master Mix Reagents in a 7500 RealTime PCR System instrument. spss 17.0 for Windows (SPSS Inc., Chicago, IL, USA) was used to test the correlations of the age, sex and each presenting symptom of the subjects with their viral loads. dacron swabs were collected in viral transport medium (VTM) and stored at 4°C. samples were transported to the professor alborzi clinical microbiology research center. RNA extraction For all samples, nucleic acid was extracted from 200l volume of VTM using a commercially available viral RNA isolation kit. the amplification process was performed using TaqMan 1Step RTPCR Master Mix Reagents (Roche, Branchburg, NJ, USA) in a 7500 RealTime PCR System instrument (Applied Biosystems, USA) as follows: 48°C for 30 minute (reverse transcription) and 95°C for 10 minute (DNA polymerase activation), followed by 45 cycles of 94°C for 10 second (denaturation) and 60°C for 60 second (annealing and extension) no./total no.
